data.text:
Here are the main reasons for choosing Hotel Luca:

Position: we are one step away from the historic center of Ivrea

Economy and Simplicity: comfortable rooms at a small price

Cleanliness: we care about our customers by offering very clean environments

Smiles: we are used to people and kindness is one of our values.

the Luca di Ivrea Hotel is located in the historical center of the city.

The entrance to the hotel is through a characteristic portico.

It's a bit like detaching yourself from the world to arrive in a simple and silent environment.

We have no claim other than to make you have a good stay, without having to spend a lot.

Below we present some of the main attractions of the city and its surroundings:

Ivrea Castle: located on the hill overlooking the city, this medieval castle offers a spectacular view of the Alps and the Po Valley. Inside it is possible to visit the civic museum and the hall of masks, which preserves the famous "carnival floats" of Ivrea.

Famous for the Carnival of the same name and its Battle of the Oranges.

Lake Viverone and Lake Sirio, with its clear waters ideal for swimming in the summer.

The Olivetti Museum

The Cathedral of Ivrea: located in the main square of the city, the Cathedral is a masterpiece of Romanesque architecture, with an interior decorated with frescoes and sculptures of great artistic value.

Santo Stefano Tower: a 27m high medieval tower, built in the 12th century as part of the city's defensive walls.

The Palazzo Civico: a Renaissance building that houses the headquarters of the Municipality of Ivrea. Inside there are the Council Hall and the Hall of Coats of Arms, frescoed by Bernardino Luini.

The Via Francigena: one of the main pilgrimage routes of medieval Europe, which crosses Ivrea. It is currently traveled by many hikers and tourists.

Candia Lake: a few kilometers from the center of Ivrea is this small lake with crystal clear waters, surrounded by woods and green hills. Ideal for a walk or a canoe trip.

What are the dishes that I can taste in the restaurants of Ivrea?

The bagna cauda: a sauce made with garlic, anchovies and extra virgin olive oil, served with raw vegetables such as artichokes, carrots, celery and peppers.

Polenta and donkey stew: polenta is prepared with corn flour and served with a donkey meat stew.

Torta 900: a cake made with puff pastry, custard and cherries, typical of the Carnival period.

The hazelnut cake: a cake made with local hazelnuts, eggs and sugar.

The black pudding: a typical dessert of the Carnival period, made with chocolate, milk, flour and pig's blood.
